contentList.content: Throughout history and the world, Vampires have been a terrifying force. Cloaked in darkness and mystery, these champions of shadow have taken many forms and committed many terrifying acts in the name of some greater evil. In this version, your vampire powers are tied to the very core of your being, while you claim your Title to truly separate yourself from the rest of the rabble.
Vampire Title focusing on shapeshifting into bestial forms
Use your Vampire Claws to attempt to grapple the opponent. Must pass an <LSTag Tooltip="Athletics">Athletics</LSTag> check.

Suck the blood from a living creature to regain [1]. The target takes [2] and [3]. Target must be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED">Stunned</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SLEEPING">Sleeping</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag>, Grappled, Restrained, Incapacitated, or Unconscious.
Hit point maximum reduced by 1d4. Creature will die if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.
This resource allows you to select blood features. The number of blood feature points you have dictates how many features you can have at once.
Your claws and bite now count as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistances.
You add your charisma modifier to the necrotic damage your bite attack does. Req: lvl 1.
Vampiric ability to charm people. Req: lvl 1, 2 blood pool points to use.
Allows you to use Vampire Bite as a bonus action with no restrictions. Req: lvl 1, 2 blood pool points to use.
Gives the vampire blindsight for one minute. Req: lvl 1, 2 blood pool points to use.
Refunds all Blood Features to select new ones.
Spend Blood Feature points to use your vampiric powers in new ways. If you fail to meet the requirements for a feature your point will be refunded after a turn.
Immunity to poison damage and poisoned and dieseased statuses. Req: lvl 1.
Spend two Blood points to get advantage on stealth checks for one hour. Req: lvl 1, 2 blood pool points to use.
Allows the vampire to spend 2 blood points to take the Dash or Disengage action as a bonus action. Req: lvl 1, 2 blood pool points to use.
Pushes the creature back, and deals extra damage based on blood points. Req: lvl 1, 2 blood pool points to use.
Allows you to summon either an invisible raven or rat.
Jump distance increased by 25ft and movement speed increased by 10ft. Req: lvl 1.
When a target misses you can spend 1 blood point to attack them with your claws. Req: lvl 1, 1 blood pool points to use.
You may use your Bite attack against a surprised or unaware target, even if they don't meet the normal requirements for your Bite. Req: lvl 3, 2 blood pool points to use.
When you are targeted by an attack from a creature that you can see, you can use your reaction to turn into mist.
Spend Blood as a reaction, getting temporary hp based on bp spent and retaliating with 1d10 necrotic damage.

As a reaction to an attack, you may expend 2 or more Blood, up to your proficiency bonus. You gain a bonus to your AC equal to the number of Blood spent until the beginning of your next turn, including against the triggering attack.

You can use your Blood to summon a number of animals to you. You spend Blood equal to the number of animals you are trying to summon (Maximum of 5). You can summon wolves and the beasts remain for 1 hour.

You can use a bonus action and spend Blood to infuse a companion with some of your undead ichor. When you do so, choose a friendly creature within 30 feet of you. That creature gains temporary hit points equal to the Blood spent + your Charisma modifier.

Your vampire saliva heals non-undead creatures, ensuring you can feed from them later. You can take an action to lick a wound; the creature gains 1d4 + your Charisma Modifer in Temporary Hit Points. By spending a Blood, you can convert those into regular Hit Points.
By spending a Blood, you can have your next unarmed Claw attack deal Acid damage instead of the normal Slashing damage.

When you hit a creature with a weapon or spell attack, you can spend Blood to distract the creature, giving your allies an opening. You add the Blood spent to the attack’s damage roll in the form of necrotic damage. The next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than you has advantage for the next turn.
You can use an action to turn into Mist by spending 2 Blood. Requires Misty Escape.

When you hit a creature with an attack, you can spend Blood to attempt to disarm the target, forcing it to drop one item of your choice that it’s holding. You add the Blood spent to the attack’s damage roll, and the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it drops the object you choose. The object lands at its feet.
When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and spend Blood to reduce the damage by the number of Blood spent + your Dexterity modifier.
You can animate an undead servant as an action. Select a pile of humanoid bones or a humanoid corpse within 10 feet, and spend a Blood.

You grow a strange covering over your skin that glitters in light. For each hour you spend in sunlight, you must spend Blood to force yourself to resist the effects of sunlight. Each time you spend these Blood, you sparkle dramatically for 1 minute, gaining disadvantage on Stealth checks.
As a bonus action, you can spend two blood to heal yourself for 1d4 plus your charisma modifier.
You can see invisibility and are now immune to being turned.

When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can spend Blood to attempt to frighten the target. You add the Blood spent to the attack’s damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

Before you make an unarmed attack on your turn, you can spend 2 Blood to cause your attacks to make the target bleed viciously. On a hit, they make a Constitution saving throw at the start of their turns for the next minute. On a failed save, they take additional Necrotic damage equal to your Constitution Modifier. On a success, they do not take this damage. They repeat this saving throw at the start of their turns for the entire duration.

Your vampiric agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a blue dragon's lightning breath or a fireball spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

Feed on a willing, charmed, or incapacitated creature that isn't an Undead, Construct, Plant or Ooze. When you Feed in this way, the creature takes no damage. You recover one Blood for each Hit Die lost in this way; humanoids restore twice as much Blood.
This creature has been fed on by a vampire using their feed ability, and cannot be fed on agian until after a long rest.
If you have zero Blood, you instead must make a Wisdom save of 11 or enter a feral rage for 1 turn.

By spending a Blood as part of your action when you make an unarmed attack against a target that has been damaged by your Hemorrhaging Claws feature, you can make the attack with advantage. You spend this Blood each time you make this part of your attack action.
Your vampiric curse strengthens your physical prowess. You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing from non-magical attacks.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can expend 1 Blood (no action required) to have 1 hit point instead.
What We Do in the Shadows

You can meld your essence into darkness itself. By spending 3 Blood as an action, you step into a shadow large enough to fully contain your body, melding yourself and all the equipment you carry with the shadows. You must use 5 feet of movement to enter a shadow. You instantly know the location of all other shadows within 500 feet and as part of the move used to enter the shadow, can either pass into one of those shadows or step out of the shadow you are in. You appear in a spot of your choice within 5 feet of the shadow that you chose, using another 5 feet of movement. If you have no movement left, you appear within 5 feet of the shadow you entered.

At 20th level, you gain the ability to unleash your full power as a Master Vampire upon your foes. Your Strength, Dexterity and Constitution scores increase by 4, to a maximum of 20 if they are not already higher. Once per day as an action, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute: You gain a flying speed of 60 ft. You regain 10 hit points at the start of each turn, provided that you have at least 1 hit point. If you take Radiant damage, this trait does not function until the start of your next turn. Your unarmed strikes (including your bite) deal an additional d8 necrotic damage. As a bonus action on each of your turns, you may choose one creature within 60 feet of you. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you until this effect ends. A charmed creature will regard you as a friend and do its best not to harm you or your allies. If you or your companions deal damage to that creature, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If someone attempts to use Greater Restoration or similar magic to cure the charmed effect, they must roll a spellcasting ability check against your Blood DC. If they succeed, the charmed effect ends and that creature is immune to all your attempts to charm them for 24 hours.

At 14th level, you can summon bats to shield and hide you. As a bonus action, you can spend 4 Blood to summon a swarm of bats from the darkest reaches of the night. These bats grant you temporary hit points equal to twice your level plus your Constitution modifier. While you have these temporary hit points, all attacks have disadvantage against you, and you gain a plus 10 bonus to Stealth checks. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

At 3rd level, your claws become even deadlier. Your Claws damage dice increases to 1d6. This increase continues at the 7th (1d8), 11th (1d10) and 17th (2d6) levels. When you hit a creature with your Claws, if the target is a creature other than a Construct, Plant, Undead, or Ooze, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Blood Feature DC or be Paralyzed until the end of its next turn. On a success, it is immune to your Paralytic Claws for 24 hours.
Can no longer be paralyzed by a ghoul's claws until after long rest.

At 7th level, you can enter a Frenzy as a bonus action. During this Frenzy, you gain the following benefits: Choose one: You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, or you have advantage on Dexterity checks and Dexterity saving throws. Frenzied Strikes: When you make your first unarmed strike on your turn, you can decide to throw caution to the wind, biting and scratching relentlessly. Doing so gives you advantage on unarmed strike attack rolls during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn. When you drop a creature to zero hit points, you can make an additional unarmed strike against another creature within your range as part of your Attack action. This can be your Bite attack, ignoring the normal restrictions for your Bite. Your Frenzy lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven't attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end your Frenzy on your turn as a bonus action.

When you make your first unarmed strike on your turn, you can decide to throw caution to the wind, biting and scratching relentlessly. Doing so gives you advantage on unarmed strike attack rolls during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.
Allows you to spend blood to dominate a beast.

Legends speak of certain ghouls who could not only ignore the fear of running water, but learned to thrive in it. You are immune to the acid damage caused by running water and resistant to cold damage.

You spend this Blood as a bonus action. For one minute after you spend this Blood, creatures that enter into a 10 foot radius around you for the first time make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they are poisoned until they leave this radius. On a success or if they leave this radius, they are immune to this poisoned effect for 24 hours.

Your feral nature manifests as the ability to extract nutrients out of any former living thing; the nutrients in question however, are not always fulfilling. You can restore Blood from consuming dead flesh. You can take use this ability outside of combat to consume a corpse. This specialized Feeding does not restore any hit points, but does restore your Blood as if you had Fed off a living creature of that type.
